item.name: Device: Temperature status
item.description: MIB: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB Temperature status of testpoint: Device

item.name: Device: Temperature
item.description: MIB: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB Temperature readings of testpoint: Device Reference: https://gtacknowledge.extremenetworks.com/articles/Q_A/Does-EXOS-support-temperature-polling-via-SNMP-on-all-nodes-in-a-stack

item.name: CPU utilization
item.description: MIB: EXTREME-SOFTWARE-MONITOR-MIB Total CPU utlization (percentage) as of last sampling.

item.name: Operating system
item.description: MIB: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB The software revision of the primary image stored in this device. This string will have a zero length if the revision is unknown, invalid or not present. This will also be reported in RMON2 probeSoftwareRev if this is the software image currently running in the device

discovery_rule.name: Stack port Info
discovery_rule.description: A unique value for each interface. Its value ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The value for each interface must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of the entity's network management system to the next re- initialization.

item_prototype.name: Stack port {#SNMPINDEX} status
item_prototype.description: The Link status of the stacking port link

trigger_prototype.name: Stack port {#SNMPVALUE}: Member is in critical state

discovery_rule.name: Stack Info
discovery_rule.description: The slot id of the stack member in the stack

item_prototype.name: #{#SNMPVALUE}: Member MAC address
item_prototype.description: The Mac address of the stack member

item_prototype.name: #{#SNMPVALUE}: Member mgmt ip address
item_prototype.description: The fallback mgmt ip address which was configured through CLI for this stack member. This ipaddress can be used to communicate with this member, if it comes up as the master. The ipaddress is associated with the vlan configured

item_prototype.name: #{#SNMPVALUE}: Member oper status
item_prototype.description: The operational status of the stack member. When the stack comes up, if there is a vector mismatch namely license mismatch or platform mismatch between the master and the member, the member remains in the mismatch state. Further communication with the member is not possible

item_prototype.name: #{#SNMPVALUE}: Member role
item_prototype.description: The role of the stack member as to whether it is acting as a master,backup or a slave

item_prototype.name: #{#SNMPVALUE}: Member stack priority
item_prototype.description: The stack priority of the stack member. The stack priority is used for the master election algorithm. The member with the highest priority comes up as the master. If there are more than one switch with highest priority, the member with the least MAC among them comes up as the master

trigger_prototype.name: Stack {#SNMPVALUE}: Member is in critical state

item_prototype.name: Fan {#SNMPVALUE}: Fan speed
item_prototype.description: MIB: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB The speed (RPM) of a cooling fan in the fantray {#SNMPVALUE}

item_prototype.name: Fan {#SNMPVALUE}: Fan status
item_prototype.description: MIB: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB Operational status of a cooling fan.

trigger_prototype.name: Fan {#SNMPVALUE}: Fan is in critical state

item_prototype.name: #{#SNMPVALUE}: Available memory
item_prototype.description: MIB: EXTREME-SOFTWARE-MONITOR-MIB Total amount of free memory in Kbytes in the system.

item_prototype.name: #{#SNMPVALUE}: Total memory
item_prototype.description: MIB: EXTREME-SOFTWARE-MONITOR-MIB Total amount of DRAM in Kbytes in the system.

discovery_rule.name: PSU Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Table of status of all power supplies in the system.

item_prototype.name: PSU {#SNMPVALUE}: Power supply status
item_prototype.description: MIB: EXTREME-SYSTEM-MIB Status of the power supply {#SNMPVALUE}

trigger_prototype.name: PSU {#SNMPVALUE}: Power supply is in critical state

trigger.name: Device: Temperature is above critical threshold
Device: Temperature is above warning threshold
Processor load is too high on {HOST.NAME}
